subject: poker night
message:
Hey BossMan,

Just wanted to check in and see if you're up for another poker night this Friday at my place. We haven't had one in a while and I thought it would be a good way to unwind after this hectic week. Let me know if you're in and if there's anything specific you'd like to bring.

Looking forward to it!

Gideon

subject: RE: poker night
message:
Sounds great!  I’ll bring some of my famous chili dip (definitely made by me and not by Walmart) and some chips. It will be a great way to end a horrendous week. :/

Emmanuel

subject: Book Club Meeting Next Week
message:
Hi Judd,

I hope you're having a good week so far. Just a quick reminder that our book club is meeting next Tuesday at 6:00 PM in the conference room. We'll be discussing “Every Single Lie” by Rachel Vincent,  so if you haven't finished it yet, you still have a bit of time. 

Looking forward to hearing your thoughts on the book!

Best regards,
Annalise

subject: Book Club Meeting Next Week
message:
No, I didn’t watch the event last night.  My wife roped me into watching the new Hallmark movie.  Believe me, I would rather watch robots annihilate each other than see another sappy romance.  But, gotta keep the wife happy.  I’ll have to look for the video and take a look.  Sounds better than what I saw, despite the controversy!

Davin

subject: Did you watch the robot combat event last night?
message:
Hey, did you see the robot combat event last night?  What did you think?  Personally, I thought the judging was very unfair.  Obviously, Tombstone is getting older, but still very competitive, and I thought he was on target for winning when out of nowhere they called the fight for Bombshell!  What the…..??!!  How could they possibly make this kind of error?  There’s no way Tombstone was disqualified. If anything, I’d say Bombshell was!  Am I nuts, or did you see  this, too?   Seriously, man, I think it’s time for me to take my robot into competition.  They need some new blood.  But I don’t know if I can trust the judging.
So, if I start competing, you think TimeLabs would sponsor me?

Shemar

subject: RE: Addressing Recent Tensions
message:
Hi Annalise,

Thank you for your email.

I appreciate you taking the time to reach out and address this. I must admit that I was hurt by the comment, as it felt like a critique of my efforts. However, I understand that it might not have been your intention to come across that way.

I also value our working relationship and believe that a conversation could help clear the air. I am available tomorrow afternoon around 2 PM if that works for you.

Let's use this as an opportunity to strengthen our communication and ensure that we are both on the same page moving forward.

Looking forward to our chat.

Best,
Geraldine

subject: Addressing Recent Tensions
message:
Hi Geraldine,

I hope this email finds you well.

I wanted to reach out regarding our conversation yesterday. I feel that there were some misunderstandings and perhaps some unintended remarks that led to hurt feelings on both sides. I value our working relationship and believe it's important to address these issues directly so we can continue to collaborate effectively.

When I made the comment about the project timeline, I did not intend to imply that you were not contributing enough. I realize now that my words may have come across that way, and for that, I am truly sorry. It was not my intention to insult or undermine you in any way. I respect your work and contributions to our team greatly.

I believe that open and honest communication is key to resolving conflicts and moving forward. If you have time, I would appreciate the opportunity to discuss this further and understand your perspective better. Please let me know when you might be available for a brief chat.

Thank you for considering this, and I hope we can find a way to resolve this and work together harmoniously.

Best regards,
Annalise
